Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Crys_travels5
Reviews.Content: When we visited, they were doing some construction and there was some scaffolding by the front. Overall, it was a great hotel. It seemed like it was newly and there was even a laptop in our room. The hotel is located just minutes from the Gran Via subway station and McDonald's. And about a 10 minute walk to Sol. There are a ton of restaurants/cafes in the area including Pan Breads just around the corner and more. Great location to go shopping, literally steps away from H&M, Zara, Lefties, etc... You willl find lot's of these stores through the Sol area! El Corte Ingles is down the road in Sol for all you shopping afficionados! It was my second time in Madrid, I visited with family. Just a warning however, I saw at least on one occassion a prostitute hanging near the alleyway... and you must buzz to get in. But overall, a pleasant stay. Not sure I would stay here again given that there are other hotels in the area. But I would recommend this for families or someone with a budget.

Reviews.Title: “The architect must have been in a bad mood”
Reviews.Author: FPinto2012
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and the beds are all right. Service is friendly. Don't expect much. They speak English well. We also bought the tour bus ticket on the front desk and they explained us everything correctly. Really well located.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good breakfast buffet, but rooms have weird smell”
Reviews.Author: she23
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Spain with a group of students and teachers, and our tour company booked this hotel for us. I was very pleased with the location--very close to metro stops, close to Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. Lots to do within very short distance of this hotel, especially shopping. Truly a great location. But, as other reviewers have stated, there is a weird sewage-like smell in the rooms. Rooms are a little tired-looking, too.. Showers are best thing about rooms-- students loved them! Rooms for 4-5 people are crowded. Putting bunk beds in a room not really designed for bunk beds is not a good idea. I think a family would find the family rooms too small. Front desk clerks not particularly friendly. Front doors are always locked. You ring a bell and they buzz you in. Currently, the entire front of the hotel is covered in scaffolding. I thought we would hear a lot of construction noise, but we didn't. Never even saw anyone working. There's a grocery store just down the street from hotel. Breakfast buffet had a good variety of foods on it, and servers kept it well-stocked. If I were booking my own rooms, I probably would not choose this hotel again due to the smell of the rooms and the old furnishings in the room (torn curtains, for example). But if you don't care about stuff like that, the location is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: idelgado
Reviews.Content: Very nicely located this hotel is nothing special but nice for a weekend and very good value for money. The rooms smell a bit weird, I don't know which air freshener they use but it is definitely not the best,however the rooms are spacious and the bathroom was quite ok. Service was not as bad as other reviewers posted though, just basic.

Reviews.Title: “PU!”
Reviews.Author: Marcasso
Reviews.Content: There was a sewage smell so bad in this place that you had to hold your breath in the halls. I think there was a back up or something which was too bad because the location is great...the room was great...the service was great. But OMG the smell was so bad when you left your room that you had to leave the hotel immediately. The entertainment was watching the prostitutes on the corner. They are everywhere but don't worry...they are harmless.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: MarkDavids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 1 night; the location was good and very close to the Metro and some tourist areas. The staff were helpful and spoke some basic English, and were friendly when we checked in at 11pm. The room was clean and decently sized for my wife, my 2 year old and I. Did not mind the not-too-private bathroom. Shower was excellent. The hotel must be located in a red light district of some sorts as the ladies of the night were down in the street all day and night. Did not damper the hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “OK location...small rooms, breakfast not included, dissappointing. won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: mshnayde
Reviews.Content: Location is right off Gran Via. Walking distance to the plazas, but far if you are elderly. No good restaurants close by and no good amenities for the price. Only one worth mentioning is free WIFI. Breakfast is not included in the price and for 18 euros can eat at a great local Cafe. Rooms are small and if you have more than 2 suitcases look somewhere else. Staff is not the friendliest and if you are out late -- plan on seeing Prostitutes less than 30 meters away from the hotel entrance. My wife did not appreciate the view. Quite a bit of a walk to the Plazas and authentic shopping unless you are just looking for the regular tourist souvenirs which takes all of about an hour to buy. Recommend to visit Torres Bermejas restaurant off Gran Via if you really want to experience authentic Flamingo Dancing. It's 39 euros per person minimum but well worth the 3 hour show....Absolutely amazing. If you go to Toledo make sure to book a full day trip and not half. Tourist guides don't spend any time at the sights and you feel rushed all the way through... Madrid is a great city but definitely take the time to experience the culture and there is so much more to see than things next to Plaza del Sol. You can stay more central and at the same price as this hotel. Will not return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms like a hostel”
Reviews.Author: C2khan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thinking it was a nice hotel.....def not.....rooms and hallways were that of a hostel.....wi-fi did not work. We stayed there 1 night and booked a hotel down the block which was much much nicer

Reviews.Title: “not bad for a 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: nolafoodlover
Reviews.Content: we found this hotel to be a decent value and in a great location. the hotel breakfast is excellent (cold cuts, hot bacon and eggs, breads, cereals, yogurt, fruit, hot coffee, fresh juice). churros and hot chocolate are nice for one or two mornings (chocolateria san gines is close by--yum!); but for a heartier, balanced breakfast, you won't find anything close to the hotel breakfast, for the price (about $10/adult, $8 for kids). especially convenient for families with kids or elderly. we paid $147/night for 4 twin beds in one room (two are fold-down, bunk-bed style), called the "family room" when you book. it's nice to know what one will pay upfront for the additional beds, which is not the case for other hotels. it was squishy in the room, with no space for laying down luggage. no table (one small desk) and no drawers to put clothes away. so i was constantly laying down luggage on the bed and having to dig through our family's clothes. there is a small closet with five hangers and a free private safe (operable with one's credit card). the bathroom was very spacious, but NO counterspace for one's toiletries and only one hook. a nice shower with steam and massage function (which you will never use). the hotel is not well-maintained and worn around the edges. my daughter nicked her finger on the showerhead where the metal coil was unraveling (the hotel promptly fixed it). also, we did find a hair when we rolled back the covers, as well as a few animal hairs on our wool coats--which, much to my disgust, is because the hotel is pet-friendly. had i known this in advance, i would never have booked at this hotel. EVENSO, believe it or not, the room felt pretty clean, was well-swept, no dust bunnies, no grime. location-wise, we did not have a problem with it being on a major thoroughfare, and found the proximity to attractions very walkable. only time we fetched taxis was at night because of the temperature drop. my 15-yr old daughter loved being in a retail area--the hotel is next door to one of the two H&M's on gran via. we slept well at night (didn't hear street noise; heater worked well), except the floors get chilly from the draft coming in through the balcony doors. but, once under the covers, the room is quite comfortable. free wifi and laptop in the room, and two in the lobby. i'm hesitant to recommend this hotel because of the pet thing. but if you don't mind that idea, and can get a great price, than yes, i think it's recommendable for its location and family room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: thefunkiestmunky
Reviews.Content: This hotel has clean, modern rooms with great showers!! It's central for sightseeing or going out. The staff are friendly and speak basic English. There's a free safe in the room and public internet in the foyer. The hotel had a young crowd though we were there in the middle of Gay Pride.

Reviews.Title: “Is there a rating less than 1?”
Reviews.Author: joecron
Reviews.Content: My heart sank when I saw the room offered to us. On the third try, we got a room that was, at the very best, bordering on "tolerable." We would have bailed out of there in a heartbeat if we could have found other rooms. Nothing available; huge soccer match that weekend and all places fully booked. The rooms are postage stamp sized, with virtually no place to store your clothes. You live out of a suitcase. The street noise is 24/7. One has to be comotose to get a decent nights sleep. Sometimes, when asking for help at the desk, I would be met with a glazed look. How does this sound: when asking for some ice, I was told there was a little store down the block where I could get some. To be as fair as possible: the breakfasts were very good, and when I needed help to cancel stolen credit cards, the person at the desk could not have been more helpful. In summary: If this were the only place I could stay in Madrid, I would not go to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but A/C a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: antrimhurler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the PPI Madrid for 3 nights and thought the location was excellent, very close to Metro stops and main tourist areas. The staff were very helpful upon arrival giving information on requesed topics. The room was clean, spacious, and quiet from outside noise apart from the air conditioning, which for me as a light sleeper gave a constant whirr noice. In fairness one of the night porters offered an alternative room but it was the same. So, moral of the story, go out for a good meal with a good few glasses of wine, and you'll sleep sound..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nonees
Reviews.Content: The price of the room was great,. But, there were four of us staying in the room, so I was a bit worried before we got to the hotel, that there wouldn't be enough room for us and our luggage. But I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room. The room and most importantly for me - the bathroom were very clean. The location was great also, walking distance to a lot of sights and close to the metro. The staff was very helpful with wake up calls and arranging for a taxi to pick us up at 4 am four our flight to venice. The entire group was happy with the room, the biggest issue anyone had was the bathroom door. It's frosted glass, but not all the way up to the top, plus the shower is glass also, so if you stand up you can see who ever's inside and ALL their business :) All in all it was nice and we would all stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful fall in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: CicelyS
Reviews.Content: We decided to go on a girlfriend getaway to Madrid.. The Metro system is very easy to navigate (easier than NYC) and just as big. Our hotel was located about a block from the metro. The best place to exchange money is either at the airport(no fee) or use the atm. We stayed a Petit Palace Italia Gran Via, a Hightech hotel. This was one of the few rooms that would fit 4 adults and they had free wi-fi. The only bad thing about the hotel was part of bathroom door was see through, but we were all comfortable with each other,so really not a big deal for a us. Our hotel was right on Gran Via. About a 5 minute walk to Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. We also got the Madridcard. It was about $100 US (for 72 hr card), but it allowed access to over 40 museums, the amusement park, zoo, aquarium, Teleferico(cable car ride) and unlimited access of the double decker tour bus. We took full advantage. The best thing to look for is the Menu del Dia (menu of the day). You get bread, first course, second course, dessert and a drink (usually wine, beer or sangria) from 9-15 Euros. There were some great little places to eat in Plaza Mayor. Cafe & Te (local chain) also had the biggest burgers ever, for about 7 euros. Wear good walking shoes because we walked alot. The museums were great, the history, the parks., street perormers. The only complaint is our 5 days ended too soon.

Reviews.Title: “humm... a bit of a disapointment”
Reviews.Author: martinisvisiting
Reviews.Content: I think it is easy to do this in bullet points! . Tiny room with uncomfortable bed. . Too hot. . Nice shower room (stupid size basin with no plug) . Not very clean - last guest's soap in the dish biscuit crumbs on the floor. . Helpful staff . this place was built to look nice, but not to be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great position and affordable price”
Reviews.Author: hanky87panky
Reviews.Content: The room was not too big but nice and comfy for two people. King size bed, mini-bar, good working internet connection (you need to ask the concierge for an id and a password). Some people expressed their concern over the bathroom door, which was glassy and see-through, but in our case it wasn't a big deal. The balcony over the Gran Via was a real pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!! 2 THUMBS UP!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vy_1982
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! Rooms are new, modern and clean! Shower is very hi tech and amazing to come home to after a day of sweating! Spacious and balcony is nice! Be warned it is right bang in the red light district so our view from balcony was of the "locals" downstairs. Proved to be fun to watch while having a smoke. Location is amazing right next to 2 train stations and shops. Sol is only a walk away which is where the night life kicks off. Highly recommended, great place. 2 thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: JackieGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We looked at reviews and were unsure of a hotel to stay in, so we arrived on main street (Grand Via) in Madrid - came up stairs on the underground and saw this High Tech sign and as we didn't want to lug our cases round Madrid looking for hotels we decided just to stay here. It was a really good choice. We had our daughter with us and the family room we were given was enormous with a larger than king size bed, and a separate room for children. The bathroom had a shower to die for , it was really large and was a power shower with 4 different sprays which was excellent. One down fall was that the bathroom door was made of glass which was frosted, but you could still see through it!! it is on a good location, and although it was overlooking the main street, I didn't hear to much traffic at night to keep me awake.

Reviews.Title: “It Bugged Me!”
Reviews.Author: Bostonmaven
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is not great for anyone over 30. The beds are too hard, the rooms big on "design" but low on comforts. A luggage rack and tissues are two things they don't seem to have heard of. In addition, bathroom doors that don't "really" close don't work for me - even when I am vacationing with my husband... let alone if I was sharing with a friend... In addition, I was bit up by bugs at the hotel.... The staffs' English was poor. The location (if you don't mind a very "lively" scene nearby of street walkers...) is GREAT! Easy walk to major sites or jump on the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the sleeping Toph!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BaronSamedi
Reviews.Content: Great location, right on the Gran Via and within easy travel by metro to anywher for 1 or 2 euros. The staff were very friendly and approachable, great spoken english. There was a massive fight in one of the rooms when we were there but the staff sorted it out very quickly and it was quiet each night thereafter. Some "interesting" people on the doorstep as it is right on the edge of a red light area but they pay you no real heed and presented no problems for any of our group. Some excellent bars and restaurants within strolling distance. Rooms were comfortable and modern and offered good accommodation at reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Lodging”
Reviews.Author: 1239Astoria
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We needed a triple room for a college daughter staying with us and the room was huge. The shower was invigorating. Balcony is small but you can step out and take a photo of the street below. The internet allowed us to unwind after a day out and about. We used the subway due to its ease of use. Literally walked out the door and you were on your way to any location. Only minor downside was the class of people right outside the door. They really did not bother you but it was a shame that it seemed to bring this great hotel down a little bit. It seemed all English speaking people there during our visit and the staff spoke English very well. No communication problem for us. The staff were very nice. Television is only National Geographic in English.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locatio”
Reviews.Author: jaishree
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. When we got out at the Gran Via metro station it was like being in the middle of Oxford street- it's not quiet (so if that's what you want look else where) but is very lively and around Xmas time was beautifully decorated. It is 5 minutes walk to Sol and then another few minutes to the main square so the location was perfect. I actually found Plaza Santa Ana (about 12-15 mins walk) to be the prettiest and liveliest location for restuarants, bars and clubs and so would probably stay there next time. The hotel looks good - it looks modern and quite plush. The first impression of the room is good. But there were some downsides. The major one being that the bathroom did not have a proper door! It was glass and did not close properly (a feature in all rooms) which I found a bit odd. Secondly, in our first room the shower kept getting flooded (something someone said in an earlier tripadvisor review so maybe its a problem with the type of showers they have) so we asked to be moved. Ask for room 510 its bigger than most and has a balcony. The rooms are quite small but have mirrors cleverly placed to make it look larger. I actually found the room too modern looking but it depends what you like. It is not the kind of hotel where you would necessaily spend time in other than to sleep. The breakfast was good and served till 11am. Overall this hotel is great if you just want an excellent base for exploring the city - which is what we did - and if you get a good deal then it's brilliant. Not the kind of hotel you would want to spend too much money on though as there are plenty others that look better in as good a location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the location (few steps away from the metro station Gran Via). We could walk everywhere because it is very central. it is quiet enough and clean and comfortable. Free internet in the room. Be ready: nobody seems to speak English in madrid. Luckily I am Italian so we understood each other quite easily.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thought the Hotel staff and Hotel were very nice and above what i expected. The room was quite large and the shower was a hydro shower with about 5 jets. Ideal for waking you up in the morning after a late night/early morning in the clubs and pubs. It is in a great location on the Gran Via and we had an unbelievable view from our balcony of all the hustle and bustle. We felt it was in a safe location,although we did not venture around the back of the hotel,it has been said it was a bit rough around there,so we took no chances.In summary tho,i liked the hotel,it was very clean and i'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice We Loved The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 days in AUGUST, once again my reference was from the trip advisor, which we were lucky for the 3rd time in our choice, the hotel is very nice the securaty very high, very clean , friendly stuff especially the Morrocen guy, he was very helpfull , the buffet was nice , but to my wonder of wonders the guy who collects the dishes never smiled which made me wonder why??? Access to the Internet was for free which was cool , the location of the hotel was great just in the centre , near whatever you want , what was said about the prostitute through one of the visitors and he mentioned same throught this site was correct , we used to watch from our room window the dealers , we received many bad comments about the location of the hotel,i.e it's a little bit scary , they warned us about the thieves , we were about to be stolen but thank God nothing happened , we were lucky , most hotels are located there , close to everything, over all we liked Madrid , no regrets whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Not What It Seemed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online and chose an executive room containing a treadmill and computer with internet access. What I got was a small room with no computer or treadmill. Instead, it had two extra pullout bunk beds which made the room feel even smaller. The room only had ceiling mood lighting and built-in accent lights on the night stands, which made it feel dark. A few of the ceiling lights were directed on the head of the bed which was blinding when I lay in bed. Nice mood lighting, but the room lacked regular lamps. All of this made the room feel even smaller and cramped. The bathroom door, as well as the wall separating the bathroom from the room, was made of frosted glass. Initially, I thought this was a nice touch, but you could hear, and see a silhouette of, your roommate going to the bathroom. The hydro massage shower sprayed water only from one side, and the body shower heads could only needle spray (kind of hurt). Towards the end of my stay, the air-conditioning stopped working which was bad news in Madrid in the middle of the hot summer days/nights. Opening the windows let some air in but let in the sounds of a rowdy hooker-alley just outside my window. Not to mention, the front desk staff wasn’t very friendly. The only good thing about this hotel was that it had a free, high-speed port in the room. Luckily, I had the right cable and a laptop so that I could find my next hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecastro
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for what we were looking for. there was a group of 3 rooms, both my brother had children so the bunk beds came in very handy and the kids loved it. we had superior double room which also came with bunkbeds but were put away and a nice king size bed. the room was a good size for us perhaps a bit tight for a family. they had a safe, a tv and A/C which came in very handy because it was extremely hot in madrid. the shower was the best - hydromassage, my brother who had the superior family also had hydromassage but his came with a radio in the shower and a seat. his room also came with a free laptop, they paid 110euros with breakfast we paid 99euros with breakfast. the best part of the hotel was the free internet access downstairs which was very convenient, the breakfast was excellent - they had all kinds of juices, cafe, spanish omelette, fruits, yogurts, breads, hams and cheeses. it was very filling. the locations was great for us being right on the gran via which is very close to puerta del sol and plaza mayor. also the cortes ingles was across the street as well as several clothing shops. it was very easy to get a taxi and our rental car agency was about half a mile down on the gran via which worked out well for us. there is a starbucks on the corner as well. taxi from the airport ran us about 20euros. The only negatives was the hotel was a bit on the dusty side, they cleaned everyday but i still found it a little dirty nothing too bad but if you are neat freak this may bother you. i had reservations on our return trip at another hotel but decided to stay here again just because it had such a convenient location especially in dropping our rental car off, there is a parking garage about 2 blocks away. the other negative is there were alot of prostitutes in the area right on the side and behind the hotel. the taxi driver warned us not to walk behind the hotel always walk toward the gran via. On our return trip we stayed in a standard and opted no breakfast because we were going to the airport in the morning, for 2 people i found this room to be perfect the only difference was no view - the first room had a great view and a little balcony, this room which was basically the same side had a view of a wall making the room a bit dark but for 75 euros it was worth it. would definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Harps100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently on a Stag weekend and I have to say that the hotel was great. We stayed in a family room which was very reasonably priced. The room even though it was quite small was very clean, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was very nice with a great power shower and contempory design. The service at reception was very good and this hotel is very next to the shops on Gran Via and only 5 minutes away from Puerto del Sol. One thing I must add is that the red light district is right on the back of the hotel but there was no problems or any trouble because of that

Reviews.Title: “Clean but still renovating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The family room was very clean and nice sized. Complimentary bar refrigerator in room. Breakfast was included and very good. The hotel, though is still being renovated. You are required to wade through a back hallway to a service elevator, that is used by the construction crew as well. Will be a better place to stay after the renovation is complete.

HotelInfo.Address: Gonzalo Jimenez de Quesada 2, 28004 Madrid, Spain
